DOC.brief_summary: It aim evaluate treatment result , rate success complication , injury give kidney measure preoperative postoperative blood urea , creatinine , Cystatin C Netrin-1 level urine Cystatin C Netrin-1 level patient low pole renal pelvis stone ( ) undergo either one treatment modality include conventional percutaneous nephrolithotripsy ( PCNL ) , mini PCNL , ultra-mini PCNL , micro PCNL , retrograde intrarenal surgery ( RIRS ) extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy ( ESWL ) .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Different Treatment Modalities Lower Pole Renal Pelvis Stones
DOC.detailed_description: In study , demographic preoperative data , image data , operative data postoperative follow-up data prospectively record accord patient information form patient low pole and/or renal pelvis stone ( ) undergo either one treatment modality include conventional PCNL , mini PCNL , ultra-mini PCNL , micro PCNL , RIRS ESWL . A total 300 ( three hundred ) patient , age 18 70 year , similar stone size location plan enrol study ; prospectively randomize one six group 1:1 ratio . By mean , conventional PCNL perform 50 ( fifty ) patient , mini PCNL perform 50 ( fifty ) patient , ultra-mini PCNL perform 50 ( fifty ) patient , micro PCNL perform 50 ( fifty ) patient , 50 ( fifty ) patient undergo RIRS 50 ( fifty ) patient undergo ESWL . Preoperatively , blood Cystatin C Netrin-1 , urine Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) , Cystatin C Netrin-1 level measure . After treatment , blood Cystatin C Netrin-1 level postoperative 6th , 12th , 24th 48th hour record . Cystatin C Netrin-1 level urine measure postoperative 12th 24th hour , urine NGAL level measure postoperative 12th 72nd hour . Besides , classical kidney function test , namely blood urea creatinine level , measure preoperatively postoperatively 24th 48th hour . Parameters list also record evaluate : 1 . Preoperative general evaluation data : Age , height , weight , body-mass index , concomitant comorbidities , prescription use , history operation ( ) , American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) score 2 . Preoperative urological evaluation data : History ESWL/PCNL/ureterorenoscopy ( URS ) /RIRS/open surgery , whole blood count , kidney function test , automatic urine test , urine culture , preoperative imaging modality ( KUB , US , CT ) , number-dimensions-localization-composition stone ( ) , existence hydronephrosis 3 . Operative data : Access fluoroscopy duration , total access duration , total fluoroscopy duration , operation duration , use double-J stent , preoperative complication 4 . Number previous ESWL seance , total duration ESWL , number shot ESWL ( ) 5 . Follow-up data : Urethral catheterization time , hospitalization time , need treatment stone-free , time full stone-free , duration removal double-J stent , existence residual stone ( ) , formation new stone ( ) , complication late time , medical prophylaxis 6 . Stone analysis
DOC.criteria: Patients plan undergo either conventional PCNL , mini PCNL , ultramini PCNL , micro PCNL , RIRS ESWL due kidney stone ( ) Patients 18 70 year old Patients unregulated diabetes mellitus diabetic nephropathy Patients blood pressure high 140/80 mmHg despite use antihypertensive drug ( ) regularly Patients chronic renal failure need dialysis Patients prerenal , renal postrenal acute kidney failure last 6 month Patients acute pyelonephritis last 6 month Patients young 18 year old old 70 year old Patients kidney surgery last 3 month abnormal kidney function Patients ureteral stone plan undergo endoscopic stone treatment time Patients history corticosteroid use enrollment study previous 3 month Patients uncontrolled thyroid disease Patients disease rapid cell turnover ( like leukemia , lymphoma , etc . ) Patients PCNL/RIRS/ESWL perform due reason procedure terminate Patients convert open surgery due reason Patients miss data
